Description: 13 beads of different shape and material. A: One bead in a flattened cylindrical shape, made of faience with a very shiny white glaze, on both flat sides a horizontal line at the same height in brown glaze. Partly uneven surface from drying? B: Half a spherical bead made of red jasper, still very uneven surface. C: One small cylindrical segmented bead made of turquoise faience. D: 10 disc-shaped beads, in a slightly smaller (3) and slightly larger (7) variant, 7 made of ostrich eggshell, one made of black stone and two made of faience, one white and one turquoise (frit?). Largest one taken for measurements.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D15.S, Mound β, level 1
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
